DataElement.preferredDefinition: Text term to identify the type of Biospecimen available for patient replacement.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery._Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products._The quality of being obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.:Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Concepts.definition: A diagnostic or treatment procedure performed by manual and/or instrumental means, often involving an incision and the removal or replacement of a diseased organ or tissue; of or relating to or involving or used in surgery or requiring or amenable to treatment by surgery.

Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.

Property.preferredDefinition: Available; obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.

Concepts.definition: The quality of being obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.

PermissibleValues.value: Neither paraffin block nor required number of slides available

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.: Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.: The quality of being obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Any material sample taken from a biological entity for testing, diagnostic, propagation, treatment or research purposes, including a sample obtained from a living organism or taken from the biological object after halting of all its life functions. Biospecimen can contain one or more components including but not limited to cellular molecules, cells, tissues, organs, body fluids, embryos, and body excretory products.
The quality of being obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::20: A specimen that is mounted for microscopic study but without preparation methods which use dyes, reagents or other materials to produce coloration in tissues or microorganisms for microscopic examination.: A flat rectangular piece of glass on which specimens can be mounted for microscopic study.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that an object of interest exceeds another object in quantity or measure or value or status.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.

A specimen that is mounted for microscopic study but without preparation methods which use dyes, reagents or other materials to produce coloration in tissues or microorganisms for microscopic examination.
A flat rectangular piece of glass on which specimens can be mounted for microscopic study.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The quality of being obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.: Tissue that is preserved and embedded in paraffin.

Concepts.definition: The quality of being obtainable or accessible and ready for use or service.
Tissue that is preserved and embedded in paraffin.

PermissibleValues.value: Greater than or equal to 20 unstained slides
PermissibleValues.valueDescription: Greater Than or Equal To 20 Unstained Specimen Slide Device Component

ValueMeaning.preferredName: Greater Than or Equal To 20 Unstained Specimen Slide Device Component
ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.: A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.::20: A specimen that is mounted for microscopic study but without preparation methods which use dyes, reagents or other materials to produce coloration in tissues or microorganisms for microscopic examination.: A flat rectangular piece of glass on which specimens can be mounted for microscopic study.

Concepts.definition: A statement about the relative size or order of two objects specifying that either both objects are the same in quantity or measure or value or status or that the object of interest exceeds the other object in one of these ways.
A number with no fractional part, including the negative and positive numbers as well as zero.

A specimen that is mounted for microscopic study but without preparation methods which use dyes, reagents or other materials to produce coloration in tissues or microorganisms for microscopic examination.
A flat rectangular piece of glass on which specimens can be mounted for microscopic study.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: attributes of a patient's laboratory sample, including the source, condition, and fixative.

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: Type; a subdivision of a particular kind of thing.

Concepts.definition: Something distinguishable as an identifiable class based on common qualities.
